availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

body.p:
City Court of Louisville
Commonwealth
vs
Joseph Hemming

The Grand Jury of this Court on the 21st day of April 18654. returned an Indictment, against Jos Hemming, for keeping a disorderly House, upon which summons were issued and executed on the Defendant, Whereupon on the 17th day of May 1864. the case coming on to be heard. and the Defendant although called, came not. a Jury thereupon was had to try the case, who found the Defendant guilty and assessed his fine at $100, and on motion of the Comths Atty a Capias Prof was issued forthwith against the Defent for said fine and costs, which was replevied by the Defendant on the 10th of June thereafter, upon said replevin bond a Fi. Fa. issued on the 22nd of October following, whereupon the Defendant paid the fees and costs in the case, amounting to $5150, the balance remaining unpaid, the Marshal of this Court, on the 24th day of December 1864, levied on the house and lot belonging to the Defendant, which property is yet in the hands of the Marshal. not having been sold for want of bidders thereon, when exposed for sale
Attest Jan'y 24th 1865 Phil Tomppert Jr C. C. C. L.
